And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Command the children of Israel, and say unto them, My offering, <FI>and<Fi> my bread for my sacrifices made by fire, <FI>for<Fi> a sweet savour unto me, shall ye observe to offer unto me in their due season.<RF>a sweetâ€¦: Heb. a savour of my rest<Rf>

And thou shalt say unto them, This <FI>is<Fi> the offering made by fire which ye shall offer unto the LORD; two lambs of the first year without spot day by day, <FI>for<Fi> a continual burnt offering.<RF>day by day: Heb. in a day<Rf>
The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning, and the other lamb shalt thou offer at even;<RF>at even: Heb. between the two evenings<Rf>
And a tenth <FI>part<Fi> of an ephah of flour for a meat offering, mingled with the fourth <FI>part<Fi> of an hin of beaten oil.
<FI>It is<Fi> a continual burnt offering, which was ordained in mount Sinai for a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD.

And the drink offering thereof <FI>shall be<Fi> the fourth <FI>part<Fi> of an hin for the one lamb: in the holy <FI>place<Fi> shalt thou cause the strong wine to be poured unto the LORD <FI>for<Fi> a drink offering.

And the other lamb shalt thou offer at even: as the meat offering of the morning, and as the drink offering thereof, thou shalt offer <FI>it<Fi>, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.<CM>
And on the sabbath day two lambs of the first year without spot, and two tenth deals of flour <FI>for<Fi> a meat offering, mingled with oil, and the drink offering thereof:
<FI>This is<Fi> the burnt offering of every sabbath, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
And in the beginnings of your months ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the LORD; two young bullocks, and one ram, seven lambs of the first year without spot;
And three tenth deals of flour <FI>for<Fi> a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one bullock; and two tenth deals of flour <FI>for<Fi> a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one ram;
And a several tenth deal of flour mingled with oil <FI>for<Fi> a meat offering unto one lamb; <FI>for<Fi> a burnt offering of a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD.

And their drink offerings shall be half an hin of wine unto a bullock, and the third <FI>part<Fi> of an hin unto a ram, and a fourth <FI>part<Fi> of an hin unto a lamb: this <FI>is<Fi> the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.
And one kid of the goats for a sin offering unto the LORD shall be offered, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.<CM>
And in the fourteenth day of the first month <FI>is<Fi> the passover of the LORD.
And in the fifteenth day of this month <FI>is<Fi> the feast: seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
In the first day <FI>shall be<Fi> an holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work <FI>therein<Fi>:
But ye shall offer a sacrifice made by fire <FI>for<Fi> a burnt offering unto the LORD; two young bullocks, and one ram, and seven lambs of the first year: they shall be unto you without blemish:
And their meat offering <FI>shall be of<Fi> flour mingled with oil: three tenth deals shall ye offer for a bullock, and two tenth deals for a ram;
A several tenth deal shalt thou offer for every lamb, throughout the seven lambs:
And one goat <FI>for<Fi> a sin offering, to make an atonement for you.
Ye shall offer these beside the burnt offering in the morning, which <FI>is<Fi> for a continual burnt offering.

After this manner ye shall offer daily, throughout the seven days, the meat of the sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD: it shall be offered beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.
And on the seventh day ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work.
Also in the day of the firstfruits, when ye bring a new meat offering unto the LORD, after your weeks <FI>be out<Fi>, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work:
But ye shall offer the burnt offering for a sweet savour unto the LORD; two young bullocks, one ram, seven lambs of the first year;
And their meat offering of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto one bullock, two tenth deals unto one ram,
